text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with spring pea curry with black
cod that's right i don't do a lot of spa
food mostly because I really love fat
and carbs but this gorgeous seasonal
twist on a Thai style green curry was
incredibly delicious despite being very
low-calorie so I just wanted to make it
clear that that was not intentional
hey sometimes it just happens and yes in
case you're wondering those are
strawberries which if I have anything to
do with it will replace diced mango is
the most popular fruit to garnish fish
with but we'll get into that later for
now let's go ahead and start this very
simple spring pea green curry sauce so
we're gonna start with some diced onion
in a saucepan set over a medium heat to
which we'll add a little bit of
vegetable oil plus as usual a nice big
pinch of salt and all we're gonna do is
cook these onions stirring occasionally
until they turn translucent okay we
don't want these to start browning up or
getting any color we basically just want
to cook them until they kind of soften
up sweeten up a little bit so we'll
continue to sweat those is they call it
in the business until they look like
this at which point we can add our green
curry paste and which should be great
news to most of you and horrible news to
a couple of you I'm using a brand of
jarred a green curry paste that you can
find in pretty much every large grocery
store in the country and while this
would obviously be better if you did
make fresh homemade green curry paste
and we will talk about that on the blog
it was absolutely delicious using this
and significantly easier and green curry
paste is nothing more than a ground
mixture of green chilies lemongrass
garlic kaffir lime leaves as well
something called galangal roots which is
very similar to ginger but like I said
we'll go over that in detail on the blog
post for now we're just going to stir
that in and cook it in that onion
mixture for a minute or two to sort of
wake it up and then once that's happened
what we'll do is we'll add a couple cups
of chicken broth or water or vegetable
broth if you prefer and we're also gonna
raise our heat too high because we need
to bring this up to a boil before we add
our sugar snap peas okay so we'll add
our liquid we'll crank up the heat and
as soon as it starts boiling we will add
one pound of sugar snap peas and if
you're not familiar sugar snap peas are
like a pea pod that you can eat
everything everything's very sweet
tender similar to a snow pea which by
the way you can substitute in this
recipe and the same goes for
regular shelled Peas but this time of
year sugar snap peas are generally easy
to find and highly recommend it for this
and then what I'm gonna do here is pop
on the lid and cook these for just about
two minutes until they just start to get
tender we do not want anything soft and
mushy here okay we want these to retain
that beautiful green color we're mostly
just taken away the rawness so like I
said rolling in to cook them for a few
minutes until that happens and there
really is only one acceptable way to
test this you're gonna have to fish one
out and test it with your teeth so I
checked one and it was perfect and once
we determine ours are just right we'll
turn off the heat and blend this until
completely smooth so I went ahead and
grab my trusty immersion blender and I
started to puree and it ended up doing a
tremendous job of not working so this
first attempt was a complete failure so
I stopped and carefully transfer that
into a blender like I should have in the
first place and you will notice I'm
doing that right in front of the
immersion blender so it really knows how
much it disappointed me but anyway we'll
go ahead and we'll use the blender on
this instead and you always want to be
extremely careful when you're blending
hot liquids never fill the blender more
than halfway all right so do it batches
if you have to and it's also a great
idea to put a towel over the top just in
case so anyway I continue blending on
high speed until it was completely
liquefied at which point we're gonna
strain this back into our pot and a lot
of times I tell you this step is
optional this time I don't think it is
okay as sweet and tender is those sugar
snap peas are like any kind of pea pod
there's gonna be a good amount of
fibrous material and if you're thinking
are we throwing away the part of the
vegetable that's supposed to be the best
for us well yes yes we are
and by straining that out you're gonna
get a much silkier much more luxurious
texture so we'll go ahead and we'll
strain our sauce and we'll place that
back on the stove on low heat and finish
with the seasoning and the first step to
that process is grabbing a spoon and
giving us a taste and since this was the
first time I've ever made this I was
assuming it was going to need some major
adjustments and it did so I added a
whole nother spoon of the green curry
paste and one drawback of the stuff in
the jar is it's generally not that spicy
so keep that in mind you might want to
sneak it an extra serrano chile or two I
also decided to add a splash of fish
sauce for a little subtle funkiness and
a little bit of saltiness and then I
also added some regular salt also for a
little extra saltiness and I stirred
that in
and decided my seasonings were just
about perfect except it needed some
acidity so I squeezed in some fresh lime
juice from a fresh lime and I stirred
that in and then gave it one more taste
at which point I decided it was perfect
for me you're gonna have to check this
and adapt it to your tastes you are the
Stefan of your curry so the final
seasonings are gonna be up to you but
once it is tasted how we want it we will
just hold that on low heat while we sear
our black cod which is only gonna take a
couple minutes because I'm going to use
some nice small 2 ounce pieces so I have
some boneless fillet with the skin still
arm it's been scaled of course and then
a great tip have your fishmonger make
some shallow cuts through the skin it's
fine to go right into the flesh a little
bit and of course you could do that
yourself with a sharp knife and not only
does that allow for a more penetrative
seasoning but it's also gonna help it
cook quicker and keep that skin from
curling the fillet up so we'll stay nice
and flat which is gonna help that skin
crisp up beautifully
so we'll season our fish very simply
with some salt and then all we're gonna
do is sear this on medium-high heat with
a little bit of vegetable oil in a
non-stick pan and since we are gonna
serve this sitting in that hot green
curry sauce
we don't want overcook this here so I'm
just gonna give it a couple minutes on
the skin side and then we'll flip it
over and give the other side a couple
minutes until it's just barely cooked
through and you can see how gorgeous
that skin looks and by the way if you
don't use black cod so many things would
work here salmon would be great
shrimp would be great mussels scallops
things like that but anyway we're gonna
cook our black cod and once that's done
we're ready to plate up so first up
we'll go ahead and ladle some of our
green curry sauce into a hot bowl and
then we will transfer in our perfectly
cooked black cod oh man that looks good
but wait there's more and I hope you're
sitting down for this but I'm gonna
garnish this with a little bit of diced
strawberry which I realize may sound
insane that is until you actually think
about it for a second all right the
acidity of a strawberry is very close to
a lemon and no one has a problem putting
that on fish and in addition that subtle
sweetness from the fruit really really
works well with that green curry sauce
and then last but not least I'm gonna
finish off with a little bit of thinly
sliced mint
okay mint and fresh peas are an age-old
combination that works so well together
and that spring pea curry with black cod
is done and I realize you may be
skeptical but all I can tell you is this
I was one of the most delicious things
I've eaten in a long time and if you can
try to find black cod it is so perfect
in this it has a very sweet mild buttery
flavor in fact one of the names for
black cod is butter fish we got that
little bit of textural thing going on
between the crispy skin and that moist
flaky meat and again as bizarre as it
may seem to you the strawberries besides
looking beautiful really pulls this dish
together they just worked so well and
yet I'm sad because I know some people
won't try this just because they can't
wrap their head around it man it was in
such a good mood - so anyway I'd really
hate to think that will stop you from
trying this dish but I've done all I can
do to hopefully convince you that this
totally works so anyway like I said I'm
no spa chef although once in a while I
accidentally play one on the internet so
if you're looking for a beautiful and
incredibly delicious light and healthy
dish to enjoy after your yoga class but
before your pleiades class I really hope
you give this a try so head over to food
whooshes calm for all the ingredient
amounts and more info as usual and as
always enjoy
